abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Abidjan
            Sewerage and Drainage Project for the Ivory Coast was
            marginally satisfactory. The project achieved some of its
            objectives, institutional development was modest,
            sustainability is uncertain, and the performance of both the
            Bank and Borrower was satisfactory. Several lessons can be
            learned from this project. First, there is a need for
            realistic projections of project timetables, loan
            disbursements, and public utility revenues. Second, rather
            than relying on debt financing, it is important to generate
            adequate internal cash, particularly in currencies subject
            to possible appreciation. Finally, it is desirable to
            maintain continuity of the Bank staff assigned to a project
            and sector.
